KasAccount.title: KasAccount
KasAccount.description: Represents a cash account within the BrimoUI application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the KasAccount entity.

label.description: The display name of the cash account (e.g., Tunai, Bank).

type.description: The type of the cash account (e.g., Tunai, Bank).

balance.description: The current balance of the cash account.

minimumBalance.description: The minimum balance threshold for the account.

color.description: The background color associated with the account for UI rendering.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Transaction entity.

type.description: The type of transaction (e.g., credit, debit).

name.description: A descriptive name for the transaction.

account.description: The account associated with the transaction.

balanceBefore.description: The balance of the kas account before the transaction.

balanceAfter.description: The balance of the kas account after the transaction.

UserPreference.title: UserPreference
UserPreference.description: Stores user-specific preferences for the BrimoUI application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the UserPreference entity.

showBalance.description: Indicates whether the user prefers to show or hide their balance.

activeTab.description: The user's currently active tab in the application.

/users/{userId}/preferences/{preferenceI.description: Stores user preferences. Only the authenticated user can access their own preferences. The 'preferenceId' should always be the user's uid. Since there will be only one document per user, this models a 1:1 relationship.

/users/{userId}/kasAccounts/{kasAccountI.description: Stores cash account information for each user. Only the authenticated user can access their own kas accounts. The kasAccounts are owned by the user, which allows list and read operations to be secured by path. This models a 1:N relationship between users and KasAccounts.

Stores transaction history for each cash account. Only the authenticated user can access their own transactions. Transactions are owned by the user, which allows list and read operations to be secured by path. This models a 1:N relationship between KasAccounts and Transactions.
